body.p:
Mt Vernon Ky
Oct 8th 1863.
To his Excellency
Gov. T. E. Bramlette

Your Petitioner Ransom Laswell would most respectfully ^state^ That at the last August Term of the Rockcastle Circuit ^Court^ he was fined $20. & costs for gaming with four others, Isaac Whitehead John Cable & Albert Owens, all confessed Judgment. Whitehead & Cable petitioned Gov. Robinson and was relieved and I do most respectfully ask that you extend the same relief to your humble petitioner Ransom Laswell. It was about my first gaming and I promise it to be my last. The game was for amusement more than profit, only bet 5 cts a game for a few games, hope you will remit the fine, as any little fine in my circumstances would bear heavily upon me.

I am Respectfully your humble Petitioner
Ransom Laswell

We the undersigned are well acquainted with Mr. Laswell and his circumstances know him to be an honest upright and good citizen a poor man, and this is the first we ever heard of his gaming, and as this little fine would embarrass him we would be highly gratified, if concistent with your sense of duty to see it remitted.

M J Cook J.C. Carter J. K. McClary
M. A. Brooks as C P Hyers Edwin Shivel,

Rockcastle Co
vs
R. Laswell
Gaming

Remit all except costs & fees
Oct 12th 1863
Tho E Bramlette
Govr of Ky
